item.title: Engine Generator Systems – Integrated Drive Generator, Generator Control Breaker

remarks.para: Except for ER operations beyond 120 minutes, one may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: APU generator is operative and is used to supply busses of inoperative channel throughout flight,
All generator control units, including APU, are operative, and
For ER operations, Hydraulic Motor Generator (HMG) is verified to be operative, and
If the APU has been operating for an extended period of time in heavy falling or blowing snow, inspect inlet plenum before departure to verify that accumulations of snow or ice are not present.
Operate APU throughout flight.
Leave inoperative GEN CONT switch in the OFF position.
Verify APU generator is powering the busses of the inoperative generator.
Verify both Bus Tie Switches are in the AUTO position and the amber BUS OFF, APU GEN OFF, and UTILITY BUS OFF lights are not illuminated.

To ensure left engine bleed valve system is properly configured for RR engines: If APU was used to start engines and remains ON following engine start, cycle APU VALVE switch OFF, then ON after starting the second engine.
During heavy falling or blowing snow, visually inspect the APU inlet plenum for snow and ice accumulation.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.
Reduce Takeoff Climb Limit Weight by 500 lbs.
Reduce Landing Climb Limit Weight by 700 lbs.
Reduce Method 1 or 2 Terrain Clearance Weight by 1,500 lbs.
Add 370 lbs/hour MEL fuel usage for APU operation.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

placard.para: Placard affected L (R) GEN CONT switch (P5) "INOP - IDG DISCONNECTED" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required for APU oil service and when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Review logbook for evidence of APU high oil consumption. If APU HOC is suspected, dispatch is not permitted.
Check and service APU oil quantity before each departure.
Check that L, R and APU generator control units and APU generator are operative.
Press BAT switch on P5 panel to ON (latched-in position) (APU and external power off).
Press two BUS TIE switches to ISLN (out position). Verify amber ISLN light in each switch is illuminated.
Verify two amber BUS OFF Lights are illuminated.
Press APU GEN CONT switch to OFF (out position). Verify amber OFF light in switch is illuminated.
Verify amber OFF lights in the L and R GEN CONT switches are illuminated, or L and R GEN OFF message is displayed.
Verify that the APU GEN CONT switch is ON (latched-in position). Verify OFF light in switch is extinguished.
Start APU. Wait 60 seconds.
Verify OFF light in APU GEN CONT switch remains extinguished.
Verify the following amber lights on P5 remain illuminated:
ISLN lights in two BUS TIE switches;
OFF lights in L and R GEN CONT switches, or L and R GEN OFF message is displayed.
Two BUS OFF lights.
Press two BUS TIE switches to AUTO.
Verify the following lights on P5 are not illuminated.
ISLN lights in two BUS TIE switches;
Two BUS OFF lights.
Verify amber OFF lights in L and R GEN CONT switches remain illuminated.
Shutdown APU.
Press BAT switch to OFF.
If IDG was not disconnected previously, start the affected engine.

caution.para: DISCONNECTING THE IDG WITH ENGINE BELOW IDLE SPEED OR WITH THE ENGINE SHUT DOWN DOES NOT RESULT IN COMPLETE SEPARATION OF THE DISCONNECT DOG TEETH. STARTING THE ENGINE WITHOUT RESETTING THE DISCONNECT OR DISCONNECTING THE IDG WITH THE ENGINE BELOW IDLE SPEED COULD RESULT IN DAMAGE TO DOG TEETH.
DO NOT ACTUATE DISCONNECT SWITCH FOR LONGER THAN 3 SECONDS. ALLOW A MINIMUM OF 60 SECONDS BETWEEN ACTUATION PERIODS.

DO NOT OPERATE THE IDG FOR MORE THAN 50 HOURS IN THE DISCONNECTED MODE WITHOUT RECONNECTION. FAILURE TO COMPLY WILL RESULT IN THE NEED TO REMOVE THE IDG AND INSPECT THE IDG INPUT SHAFT BALL BEARING ASSEMBLY FOR WEAR.
IT IS ACCEPTABLE TO DISPATCH WITH LOW OR NO OIL IN THE IDG IF THE IDG IS DISCONNECTED. IF DISPATCH IN THIS CONDITION, THE IDG MUST BE CHANGED AS PART OF ANY MAINTENANCE ACTION TO CLEAR THE DEFERRAL.

numlitem.para: Momentarily press the affected GEN DRIVE DISC switch no longer than 3 seconds and verify amber DRIVE light in affected GEN DRIVE DISC switch and white FIELD off light in generator field switch illuminates (A/C N401-426UP).
Verify the following readings for the left (or right) power channel on lower EICAS display:
FREQ = 0 ± 5
Verify the following messages appear on EICAS:

note.para: If IDG Low Pressure switch is inoperative in the OPEN mode, the associated DRIVE light will not illuminate and the associated generator drive message will not be displayed, and therefore, item C. (above) should be disregarded.

numlitem.para: L (or R) GEN OFF
L (or R) GEN DRIVE
